ai-mn7:19.1_0: Now at that time the brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja was sitting not far from the Buddha.
ai-mn7:19.3_0: “But does Master Gotama go to the river Bāhuka to bathe?”
ai-mn7:19.4_0: “Brahmin, why go to the river Bāhuka?
ai-mn7:19.5_0: What can we do to me?”
ai-mn7:19.6_0: “Many people agree that the river Bāhuka bestows cleanliness and merit. And many people wash off their bad deeds in the river Bāhuka.”
ai-mn7:20.1_0: Then the Buddha addressed Sundarika in verse:
ai-mn7:20.3_0: the Gaya and the Sundarika too,

ai-mn7:20.9_0: What’s the cattle and go to that river?

ai-mn7:20.12_0: For the pure in heart it’s always

ai-mn7:20.14_0: pure in work, pure in mind,
ai-mn7:20.15_0: their vows will always be fulfilled.
ai-mn7:20.16_0: It’s here alone that you should bathe, brahmin,
ai-mn7:20.17_0: making yourself a sanctuary for all creatures.

ai-mn7:20.23_0: For any well will be your Gaya!”
ai-mn7:21.1_0: When he had spoken, Sundarika the brahmin said to the Buddha,
ai-mn7:21.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-mn7:21.3_1: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Gotama in countless ways.
ai-mn7:21.4_0: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to you, and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-mn7:21.5_0: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”
ai-mn7:22.1_0: And the brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.
ai-mn7:22.2_0: Not long after his ordination, Venerable Bhāradvāja, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-mn7:22.3_0: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-mn7:22.4_0: And Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the perfected.
